Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice with part of floor of bowl; white slip on exterior, partly worn; glazed streaky brown with traces of two added white bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The steep incline of the foot indicates that it belongs to a later vessel than those in the Wild Goat Style. The thickness of the foot suggests that it belongs to a large or heavy chalice. These vessels are typically found in the Mature Animal Style or Grand Style.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 755, pl. XXI, no. 755)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 406)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0650) (phase 2)
